main event: On April 8, 1961, a resident of Eagle River, Wisconsin, Joe Simonton, reported encountering a UFO that landed near his home, from which he claimed to receive pancake-like cakes from occupants of the craft.
interesting points: The object was described as circular, approx. 30-40 feet in diameter, with a shiny metallic surface., Witness reported two beings in black suits that handed him the 'cakes' after he offered them water., The cakes were analyzed and found to be composed of common ingredients like flour and sugar., The incident received widespread media attention, stirring public interest and skepticism., Dr. J. Allen Hynek, a noted UFO researcher, was involved in the investigation of this incident.
witness description: Joe Simonton, a mature individual and part-time chicken farmer, who later expressed a belief in his experience.
